events.message: I reported a car accident that occurred on May 1st where my vehicle collided with another on the highway.
The insurance claim has been categorised under auto accident due to the involvement of my vehicle in a collision.
An insurance agent has been assigned to assist me in navigating the claim process for my car accident case.
The insurance provider officially acknowledged receipt of my accident claim and confirmed opening a case file.
The agent requested additional documents, including accident photos and a police report to verify the collision details.
I submitted all requested documentation, including the police report and repair estimates, through the online portal.
The insurance company began its investigation into the circumstances of the vehicle collision to assess liability.
The investigation was completed with confirmation that the collision was caused by the other driverâ€™s negligence.
The insurance company proposed a settlement offer covering my vehicle repairs and related expenses after the investigation.
I provided feedback expressing satisfaction with the prompt handling and fairness of the proposed settlement offer.
The insurer formally approved my claim, confirming the coverage and commitment to pay for the necessary repairs.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued and transferred to my account to cover the vehicle repair costs.
After payment completion, the insurance claim related to the auto accident was officially closed with no outstanding issues.
The closed claim file was archived in the system for record keeping and future reference if needed by either party.
